Description: Conical foot sherd of Chian pottery chalice; white slip on exterior, glazed streaky black (fired reddish); inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The number 364 is written in pencil on the interior surface of the foot. Very little remains of the foot. the steep incline suggests that it is later than the chalices in the Wild Goat Style.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0673) (phase 2)
